description: Anglo-Irish, from Irish piseog (“witchcraft”), from Middle Irish piseóc, pisóc.

entries.meaning: Magic, witchcraft; a spell, especially one designed to cause or cure illnesses to man or beast, or to increase or decrease the quantities of farm products such as butter or milk.
examples: Pishog: A mystic rite, by which one person is enabled to make a supernatural transfer of his neighbour's butter into his own churns.
